Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel in october.i had a few doubts about the location, but with the metro it is a piece of cake to go where ever you want!!! the staff was great, really helpful, smiling....especially receptionthe are ready to give you all the information you need for the visit in barca.,brekfats lady and the guy at the spa.( the spa area is sooo cozy and relaxing)try it out. the rooms are excellent,big,really modern and equiped with all you need for a smash holiday!!it's what you need for a relaxing time!! nearby you can find a big shopping center. if we would go back to barca we would definetly choose this hotel again!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and bright”
Reviews.Author: p4u1
Reviews.Content: Quite modern building and very well decorated and equipped hotel. Very close to the sea shore and big city forum. Very good connection to public transport system - just 10 meters from the nearest subway station "Forum". The hotel is surrounded by small and chip cafes and restaurants. Drug store and food market is about 5 minutes by walking. Very interesting design of the rooms (especially bathroom) and flexible furniture arrangement.

Reviews.Title: “hip and fun”
Reviews.Author: Idontwannagohome
Reviews.Content: Our South of France trip was canceled due to volcano. Hit NYC and met a bassist at a jazz club who said getting into Barcelona was still an option. We pricelined this hotel and never having been to Spain had an adventure getting to the hotel. It was sleek, trendy and we fell in love with the guys at the front desk. Its a short walk to the metro and then its easy navigation to anywhere in the city. We arrived on a sunday and there was a huge Catalune folk festival across the street. That was fun. We ended up at the mall next door and we were starving and very reluctant to eat at a mall restaurant. OK, it was so good that we went back later in the week. Huge grilled seafood platter, sangria, like 50 euro. This hotel is not on the famed Ramblas and if thats your aim look elsewhere, but this is a classy slice of hospitality and shouldnt be missed. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “New bulding and bad quality hotels”
Reviews.Author: Criton
Reviews.Content: A -The water of the Sauna showers is not cold as it should imperatively be. The showers only give warm or lukewarm water, Which ruins the benefit of sauna. / costs of the sauna : 55 Euros B - It took one entire day to warm up the room, despite the fact that I programed the right temperature. C - I noticed that breakfast was not up to standard, therefore I had to renounced breakfast. D - The sound button regulation in the bathroom gave a deafening sound.(the room maid should imperatively verify the regulation of that button for each new customer). E - The buttons situated at the bed's top, supposed to regulate light in the hole area do not function properly. F - The glasspannel in the bath tub should be movable, it is difficult to get into the bathtub, and it is very difficult indeed to let the water out of the bath. G - The entry to the WC is far too narrow., not enough space. H - the breakfast room should be larger and better decorated, the quality of the food should be dramatically improved. There should be no queue at breakfast entrance. the hotel is new, but not up to standard. Yours thankfully, C.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel catering for families and very helpful multilingual, professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: Barono
Reviews.Content: Our experience in this hotel was very positive. The warm welcome made us feel at home immediately. We chose this hotel for its proximity to the Cirque du Soleil – the purpose of the trip. Not many hotels in this area cater for families as well as the Diagonal Zero. In fact, it is the only one we found with a family room. The rooms are two standard hotel rooms leading on to a play area with a lockable external door. The only niggle we found was having identical key cards for the rooms. If the key cards could open both rooms, then this would be a lot easier. Or failing that, mark the cards with the room numbers. As we had young children (6 and 7 year olds) we didn’t feel that we could leave them alone in the 2nd room by themselves. So, our solution was to have one adult and one child in each room. The separate room would be fine for children of 11 to 12 years old. Another solution would be to take the Jacuzzi suite which is more expensive, but the children are then properly supervised. We didn’t like the idea of leaving our children alone in their own room, although they are well-behaved. (Madeleine McCann syndrome on our part). We asked a member of staff to recommend a good Spanish restaurant, which was given with enthusiasm. The receptionist organized a taxi for us to La Fonda del Port Olimpic – a wonderful culinary experience. The dishes we chose were suckling pig, turbot and paella all washed down with a Crianza Rioja – a memorable meal. The children were made very welcome and could practice their Spanish language. The highlight of the trip was the performance at the Cirque du Soleil. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the beach. The 3-day rain was no problem as there is a large shopping centre with cinemas and restaurants opposite the hotel. The Zero has a spacious, private, clean and well-lit underground car park. The 3 x 13 person lifts/ elevators have a security feature which can only be used with the room key card. Large flat screen TVs, comfortable bathrooms, minibar, snacks, microwave, state-of the-art computer-controlled temperature and ambiance lighting system and smoke detectors all made our stay a wonderful experience. We intend to visit the Diagonal Zero soon and will go for the Jacuzzi suite next time as there is free entrance to the Wellness Spa and 15th Lounge included. A big thanks to all the staff, including the bar staff with Guinness available! ☺

Reviews.Title: “How Wonderful??You must stay here”
Reviews.Author: CocoBrown1216
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome...all front desk staff spoke wonderful English. It is almost embarrassing that you can travel out of the US and the others know the language better than some of us that live here...VERY good bar area, attentive staff and the service was NOT slow...just right! The restaraunt was AWESOME, the food was incredible, really...I love food, very fresh and well seasoned. It was mushroom season...need I say more...oh, some of the best wines...most tips are included in the costs, so you may want some clarity before handing over extra hard earned euros. The rooms in the hotel were exceptionally cleaned. The only thing about Spain is that they eat pretty late in the afternoon, like 8:00pmish that is very late if you are from the US. Most places are closed on Sunday, the way it should be...it is directly across the street from one of the nicest malls I have ever seen. The Train stop is directly outside the hotels lobby. very inexpensive and it takes you right into the heart of Barcelona...go ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Diagonal Zero Barcelona Hotel - A pleasant change from 'quaint'”
Reviews.Author: RobDSue
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 days in Barcelona and decided to stay out of town at the 4 star Diagonal Zero Barcelona Hotel for 133 euro per night, including a good breakfast. After two years in Europe we have tired somewhat of quaint hotels with inadequate facilities and the Diagonal was a refreshing change - quite modern with all the facilities expected of Australian or US hotels, except for an electric jug/kettle! Tea and coffee was to be made in a microwave. They have an excellent gym and heath facilities, good restaurant and a cocktail bar - very good cocktails but lacking in comfort and ambience. Barcelona was only a 10-15 minute train ride away - on an excellent service which was also quite cheap - the T10 (10 trips) ticket cost only about 7 euro in total.

Reviews.Title: “good located Business-hotel with good value/price ratio”
Reviews.Author: Yoda-Switzerland
Reviews.Content: friendly personell and good service offering (food late evening), clean rooms, centrally in Barcelona with a fair ratio value vs roomprice. great lake view. fast and strong wireless service available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaxRipley
Reviews.Content: The Zero stands at the end of Avinguida Diagonal in front of the sea ( a plus). Easy connection to the center (metro or tram), approx 20 min. to Placa Catalunya. It's more a business hotel in terms of services (ie breakfast very basic and med/low quality) I stayed at Executive floor in a room with side sea view, around 30 sqm, nice furnitures, 33 lcd and all 4 star frills. Small pool on 15th floor and nice gym & spa, all free for Exec clients. PLUS Free computer 24 hours with printer, all brand new !! BAD Executive lounge very poor: sodas not cold, just same snack put on the desk, no waiter....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but don't count on ocean views”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveler32
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Close to convention center. Only complaint is that even though it was slightly more expensive I booked through the hotel's webiste as it promised ocean views if you did so. I arrived very late so didn't realize til the morning I had a lovely view of a construction site on the other side of the hotel which was disappointing. As there was a conference on I couldn't change rooms.

Reviews.Title: “quite modern, maybe a bit too modern”
Reviews.Author: photoswiss
Reviews.Content: Well, nice hotel, relaxing, quiet, good beds ... all very nice. Big down - shower area which looks beautiful but there is no curtain or door and the whole bathroom floods whenever you have a shower, furthermore very slippery, no grip on the shower and bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, a little bit out of town.”
Reviews.Author: Marge79_10
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it seemed good value for money for a weekend away. While it was a little out of the way, it was only 6-8 metro stops to the city centre, less than 20min, and the hotel itself was lovely. We took a room with access to the roof terrace (help yourself to a beer or glass or wine after a long day walking and sit on the comfy sofas overlooking the seafront - fantastic!) and spa (which we didn't have time to use). The room itself was comfortable, the staff friendly and the buffet breakfast good. There;s a shopping centre next door which is good for a quick bite or some clothes shopping too. Free wifi included, which worked well in our room on the 13th floor. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Worst staff ever seen, deep-frozen room, foul water swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: sofiapiedra
Reviews.Content: Though the location of the hotel is quite nice and it is well equipped, the staff was completely incompetent. Starting at the arrival that they had reserved a twin-beded room instead of a double room with one kind-sized bed, the peak was reached when the cleaning woman threw away the pastries we bought for next day's breakfast and our voucher for the flight back home!!! When we went to the reception to ask them to manage this problem the receptionist Javier phoned housekeeping and told us to wait for ten minutes. After half an hour of waiting we decided to phone the tour operator, therefore we asked the second receptionist to dial the number for us. She explained to us that we should call from our room, where we would have had to pay for it, but when we told her what was going on she left the phone to us. Fortunately our tour operator sent the voucher by email to us, so we were able to get back home. Later this day we met Javier in the elevator. He didn't apologize, he didn't even say "hello", he just looked the other way! The next morning we went to the reception again to talk to the manager and complain about he whole problem. After all the manager said that he was sorry and that he would talk to Javier to tell him that he should apologize personally... We can only say that that all took at least five hours of our holiday, not to mention all the excitement and that the frase "Maybe he will apologize personally" didn't satisfy us at all!!! Furthermore the air conditioning is very bad, as soon as you leave the room it automatically begins to cool down at approximately 15 degrees centigrade. Even though we switched off the air conditioning when we entered the room we were freezing in the night and when we departed both of us had a cold. Once we met other guests in the elevator who told us that they had to move to another room because their shower "was like a swimming pool". Apropos: the swimming pool which is located on the roof is very very small, that may probably be the reason why it's so terribly contaminated. Immersing your head one short time into the greenish water means red eyes!!! All in all we really can't recommend this hotel, our stay there was just a desaster.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great but not really for Leisure”
Reviews.Author: RennieK
Reviews.Content: Was a bit concerned about this hotel as I read the reviews regarding the lighting etc, but gave it a go. It was a new hotel and that was why we stayed. This hotel has mixed clients, mostly on business but a few on leisure as the pool was over crowded with guys splashing around and yelling, we didnt go in. As far as the restaurant goes, Checked in after 10pm and restaurant greeted us to a lovely meal and our waiter recommended a great regional wine, prices where cheaper than expected. Same with breakfast - thumbs up for variety. Room was brightly painted, the bathroom doesnt have the privacy for 3 people sharing (slight mould in corners of shower) and mini bar fridge is a bit of a joke, so we couldnt put our own drinks in there. Hotel is close to metro, tram and buses, we took the tourist open roof bus that was just across the street which I recommend to see the sights. Shopping centre across the road is handy aswell. Wifi is a weak signal and had to stand by the rooms door to pick it up mid strength and had a bad sleep as my bed had a plastic matress proctector on it that crumpled evertime I moved.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, unfriendly and too far out!”
Reviews.Author: Poppy0975
Reviews.Content: Shower in our room was broken, no tea/coffee facilities. breakfast was very overpriced for quality of food. The woman that was on reception in the Spa was extremely rude because we were 3 mins late! ( waiting for lift was the reason!) very abrupt and rude Hotel reception was cold, the bar had absolutely no atmosphere and never open late, Very unfriendly staff :( The pool was freezing and we had no where to sit all seats taken. The pool area mostly in the shade :((((((

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Rubbish ! Too many good hotels in Barcelona to need to stay here”
Reviews.Author: LouiseKennedy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a conference. Bedrooms look good but in practise are crazy. Intelligent lighting has a mind of its own - we had to take bulbs out to sleep as some just would not turn off. We had walk in shower which turned into a lethal ice rink when wet - hence later addidions of grab rails which get in the way. Impossible to visit bathroom in night without waking up partner as the blind between bathroom and bedroom is not a blackout. No hot water on first night. Also power cut which isnt hotels fault - however when power came back on every light in the room came on with it ! Just very badly planned - I suggest the owner of this hotel stays here for a few nights and sees for themselves just how bad it is. Huge glass windows by lifts dirty and since I arrive have not been cleaned. Same in bedroom. Breakfast probably the worst I have ever endured. 'Hot' food is put out when it opens and just sits there getting colder - I asked for an omlette which every other hotel I have stayed in is happy to provide - but not here. First morning I arrived half an hour before it closed and there was no fruit left - and none more put out - eggs cold and congealed - staff took my plate away to warm it up but never came back until I asked for it 20 mins later by which time I needed to leave. In a city that is full of hotels there is no need to put up with this standard - if it was cheap then you could say you get what you pay for - but it isnt so stay somewhere that tries harder. Rooftop pool pointless and COLD!! Havent they heard of solar heating ??? Near congress centre so built as a business hotel - hence the prices - absolutely no point in staying here if you are a tourist as there is nothing to do at this end of the city and nowhere decent to eat nearby. The few staff there are around are plesant and try to be helpful - but they are few and far between. As we were staying longer than most people probably do we needed a few more coathangers but was told there wernt any - so bought some from supermarket across the road as was easier! Not very 4 * However there is one good point - free Wi-fi !

Reviews.Title: “A Brilliant newly built hotel, Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Aneilakhan1
Reviews.Content: I know its been a year! but i just came across how useful it is to share our views with one another as i am using trip advisor to book my next holiday in Egypt! We had a fab time in this hotel, we actually went as part of our honeymoon for a week. The first room we was given didnt have much of a nice view ... so the staff happily changed it! I must say the drinks at the bar are expensive (even though we are not alcohol drinkers!) the lobby at the back was great fun to relax in ... and its lovely to explore the areas outside the hotel .... ! Good luck people!

Reviews.Title: “Looks better on the internet”
Reviews.Author: Wendy030
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very weird set up in the rooms, the bathroom has a window which looks out into the bedroom!! Clear glass, but has a white roller blind that you can pull down, however when you put the light on in the bathroom everyone in the bedroom can see what you are doing!! We mentioned it to reception and they put a towel up as well which didn't come all the way down so we had to sellotape newspaper alaong the bottom for some privacy. The man on reception said ' oh everyone complains about that'!!! Also the sun deck and pool area are very small, not enough sun loungers and you get the usual - people bagging them early and leaving their towels on them all day so we never got a chance to sit up there. Although a long way out it has good bus service to the city and a great shopping centre opposite with loads of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: drewpy550
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here and was very impressed with this hotel. Friendly staff, good clean rooms and quiet so sleep no problem. The beach is with 10 mins walking distance from the hotel and 5 mins walk from a great shopping mall Diagonal Mar where there are lots of great restaurants. The metro is a 2 min walk and a 10 min journey or 6 stops to the centre of the city with no changes. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Jannemije
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and we loved it! Nice room, good breakfast, our daughter liked the (small) pool on the 17th floor very much. Across the street there is a big shopping mall "Diagonal Mar", there you can also take the red open tour bus for sightseeing Barcelona. Tickets with discount available at the receptiondesk of the hotel. Metro is just around the corner, in 20 min. you are in the centre of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, perfect for a relaxing city break!”
Reviews.Author: Pontybird
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel not too close to the hustle and bustle but somewhere we could get a feel for the non touristy side of Barcelona and this hotel kind of gives you that. The hotel itself is lovely, very modern and clean, lots of space and storage area in the room, it's on a main road which isnt too bad at night; there's a tram stop just outside which takes you up the Avenue Diagonal. The breakfast is lovely, lots of choice, hot and cold buffet, you have to use the machine to make your own coffee which is a bit of a pain but it tastes nice. The rooftop pool is a nice touch, somewhere you can grab a lounger and have a chillout and a read if you like, but FYI, just across the road is the Parc de Forum which is a huge lido where you can swim or just chill out, very popular with the locals. WHen you're walking toward it it looks like you're heading to an old quarry or something, but dont be fooled, its fab. The hotel is in an area that is being redeveloped and there is a pretty decent mall just across the road too, with all the big chain shops you can think of, the Mango store is excellent! There's a huge store like a Tesco or WallMart in there where you can stock up on cheap nibbles and wine if you fancy having a quiet night in. Room Service is good, dont keep you waiting too long, English is very well spoken throughout hotel and staff are friendly. The bar just by the reception is lovely, it's got a nice outside area too where you can sit and enjoy a beveridge. Prices are the usual hotel costs. The nearest metro is El Maresme Forum, basically you exit the station walk straight on, take a right and walk to the end of this street where you will find a restaurant/cafe, and you'll see the hotel on your left on the other side of the road about 3/4 mins from the station. Handy. It's 9 stops from the Passeig de Grassia where you need to change at if you're getting the train from the airpor, dont be fooled though as you have to walk a good 5/8mins to the yellow line as the passeig de grassia is huge!!! Make sure you buy the T10 metro ticket cos it's v cheap and if there are two of you travelling you can both use it, you dont need to buy two! The Bus Touristica is well worth it, we got the two day pass to make sure we got the most out of it, but one day will do you if you're happy to use the metro. The bus was pretty quiet on the Sunday meaning we had no probs jumping on and off, but on the Monday it was carnage, avoid getting on at the Plaza de Cataluna as the queues are huge (it's at the top of Las Ramblas). We didnt have any pick-pocket problems, in fact didnt see anything bad at all, we didnt bother walking down Las Ramblas though, just looked down it, that was enogh for us to be honest. The gothic quarter is def worth a wander around, Sagrada Familia = immense and a must see, Park Guell is beautiful and another def must see. Nou Camp tour really good, they let you into all the good bits, dont go on a Sunday afternoon though as its closed. We loved the hotel and Barcelona and would def go back to both :-)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Betttyblue
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this hotel was a disappointment. I wish I could be more positive, I normally am, but a few things (especially the maids) made this a bad experience. Negative: -When we first entered the hotel it smelt like sewage in the lobby. -The deskman could not find our booking at first, which was a bit stressful. -We were given a room at a smoking-floor, even though we booked non-smoking, this may explain the bad smell in the hall and at the room. -The room smelt weird when we entered it (the bathroom smelt like pee), the air improved a bit after we had put on the air condition for a while. -The thing that ruined the experience the most were the maids! I have never in my life experienced more annoying maids. They knocked on our door in the morning and came in to our room while we were asleep and wanted us to leave the room in 20 minutes. This happened every morning. And most of the days they had not even done our room in the afternoon when we returned from the beach (to take a shower before we went out again). We stayed only 5 days, and some of our plans were ruined because of this. For example, we planned to go to a museum and watch a flamenco show one day, and the room was not ready when I got there four o'clock in the afternoon. The maid told me to wait 20 minutes, and I went down in the lobby and waited 30 minutes. When I returned the room was still not ready, and I had to wait for an hour in the hall, sitting on the floor because they never finished. We didn't reach the flamenco show, and the next day there was no show, and the day after our plane left, so we missed the flamenco :( Every morning we were stressed because we knew they were going to knock and enter our room and nag, and every afternoon we were stressed because we wondered if the room was finished so that we would reach our plans.... -The water pressure in the shower was a joke, you had to stick to the wall to hit the water. However, you would then hit a button on the floor that closed the drain, so that you had to stand in this strange position. -What's up with a big window into the bathroom? Most people enjoy privacy at the toilet.. -We asked in the desk if we could get a knife and spoon to our room. He said it was no problem. Five minutes later they called our room and told us we had to call another number and order it through room service. So we did, but they said we had to order food or something from the menu to get a knife and spoon....most cumbersome way I have ever tried to obtain a knife and spoon.. -We wente to the roof to check out the sunbeds..there were no available, and when we laid down on the floor it smelt pee. -When we booked the room we though it was close to the beach. Unfortunately it was not possible to cross the motorway, and we had to walk for 15 minutes to find a way down to the beach. -Even though the area was quiet, the trip to the city centre was a little bit far Positive: -The bar staff were very nice and helpful. -The staff in the restaurant (Echo) were extremely nice and friendly, and the food was delicious! We had a meal at that restaurant just before we left, which actually improved the whole impression. I wish we used the restaurant more often when we were there. -The internet connection was good. -The technical facilities were good. -The rooms were nice and spacious, big closet and big pillows. -The shopping centre across the street was convenient. I will not book a romm here again. But I would love to eat at the restaurant again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NCRBrady
Reviews.Content: this hotel is near the convention center which is why I stayed there. It was modern, convenient and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was not ideal for sight seeing though and it would be nice to have coffee service available every morning to all the guests. Great gym.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay near the conference center.”
Reviews.Author: brandt32
Reviews.Content: Fine breakfast - a lot to choose between. Wireless internet didn't function at my room - 2. floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great family room - cool hotel, not ideal for young children and not cheap”
Reviews.Author: MJH1
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 1 night as part of journey back from southeren spain with my wife and 2 kids (5 & 3 years old) Booked the hotel completely on spec via on-line room broker - didnt look at reviews, pictures etc. PROS Hotel is very cool It is immaculate Been to similar hotels where staff can be too cool for school, but here everyone was really friendly - particularly Eduardo on front desk and Fabien in restaurant I booked a 4 person family room - this turned out to be 2 connected rooms, the main room being a really luxurious jacuzzi room with a thickly carpeted floor, really trendy fixtures, big lcd tv and media centre etc.. and, the main feature, a hot tub slap bang in middle of room - sounds cheesey, but it was really nicely done - the kids loved it!! 17th floor roof top pool was lovely - kids loved that too!! Gym and spa facilities looked spot on too, although we didnt get time to use The hotel has good underground parking facilities - although theres an additional fee, the parking is easily accessed, once you know where it is!! (Signage from road required!!) We were too tired to explore at night, so ate in the hotel restaurant which is in a small, very well designed courtyard out back - good food, wine and service I thought the 2 interlinking rooms plus facilities represented good value in general CONS Location - the hotel is a bit out of town centre near the Olympic Port - if you dont mind walking or getting tram then this is not an issue Upside of loacation is it is easy to drive to when coming along coast road Doesnt really cater for kids - felt all of the hotels "hip" clientele were aghast to see 2 small kids running around (to my amusement). Limited kids menu at night and very expensive - double the choice and halve the portion size & the price please Breakfast price was very steep - we ate out There was no hot water for the hot tub in the morning - perhaps we used our allowance the night before!! The sliding glass toilet door kept jamming The ice machine wasnt working - got some from next floor, no big issue One other minor annoyance, which ive seen in other hotels to be fair, is the mini bar whereby if you move anything it appears on the bill - a nightmare if you have small kids!! Im writing this review on my PDA so I havent checked the bill / had the debate with reception, but Im sure it will be not an issue! Overall, we enjoyed our brief stay here and would come again but only for adult get away - the room, parking, meal and drinks came to 400 euros approx for 1 night

Reviews.Title: “Design Hotel in the Forum area”
Reviews.Author: pot28
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern and with design ......a reflection of the city. It is not in the city center, but in an area with other business, shopping, beach and the Forum. Great Spa facilities and trendy bar. The staff and the service were good and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Three-star hotel for four-star prices”
Reviews.Author: mainiac207
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with Diagonal Zero. We had a family room that slept three. It felt a lot like a dorm room, perhaps in part because there was no carpeting and the furnishings were so Spartan. The bathroom situation was quite unfortunate, as there is a window from the bathroom into the main room. There is a shade, but it's not opaque -- I noticed with a light on in the bathroom, I could read through the shade. So it was not good for our mixed-gender family group. There's a generous wardrobe, but only three very shallow drawers to put stuff in. For three of us staying a week, it was hard to find appropriate places to put our stuff, and I quickly got tired of looking through piles of things since the drawer space was beyond inadequate. There is an annoying system on the minibar and snacks, and if anything is move, you're charged for it. Which means that you can't store other things in the fridge. No coffee maker. Insufficient places to hang wet towels. Not good tolietry items, and the bottles don't seal; some of the items looked to have been used before by others. Not much free counter space in the bathroom. We were very disappointed to discover that although the beach was "right there", you can't get to it (this might be a temporary situation, due to construction... I couldn't tell), and instead had to make plans to visit beaches elsewhere. The hotel pool was lovely, though, and the athletic facilities were nice. The breakfast was pricey but a nice buffet spread, and we did have dinner there one night and enjoyed it immensely. There is nothing to recommend this part of town. So, both due to the inadequacies of the hotel and the location, I wished I'd stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: romma350
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel with a good service in a +- good location. Tramway / metro at 20m good Value

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, would go again there”
Reviews.Author: ChrisChrysostalis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Diagonal Zero hotel. It is an attractive modern hotel with all the facilities one could need. We found the hotel very clean and the cleaning service very good. In terms of location, it is not the best location as you can not really walk to the city centre (around 6 kms). However it has a metro station very near so you will not feel any problem. Given that that it is quite far away from the centre, there is not much to do in the surrounding area. The rooms were comfortable, the bathroom good and we had facilities that were useful (microwave, minibar & wifi). Especially the wifi was very much appreciated as it had a very good signal strength. One negative that we observed was the room service were we ordered once and the quality of the food was below average in our opinion (this explains the poor in the service section). In terms of value for money it was good for the services offered, would have been very good if parking was free (very expensive at an area were in reality there is not much of a problem to find a parking space). We had no problem sleeping as we could not hear any sounds and the beds were very comfortable. We had no breakfast and we did not use the outdoor pool so no info on this. We recommend the place and would go again given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “contemporary, modern hotel for the young at heart”
Reviews.Author: Europeaninindia
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is situated beyond 'downtown' and the tourist circuit- it is located close to the beach, and the new urban expansion of Barcelona. So a lot fo exploring for those interested in art, architecture and sports. This new hotel has all the trappings of an urban contemporary hotel, side stepping any over the top luxuries. Our stay was modern and comfortable and would tend to recommend it as a hotel for business stay rather than for tourism where one might prefer to be based in the 'heart of the action': barrio gotico. The hotel is modern not only in its ambiance but also in its approach to design ( especially the hyper modern bathrooms) and menu. The restuarant menu is focussed around healthy eating, and the breakfast had a variety of vegetarian fare too. The rooftop pool though small, is a great place to chill after a day's work, with vistas of the city stretching around you. The staff were helpful and efficient, as was the rest of the hotel. Will come back for sure, and chill out with a wine after work in the patio at the back...

Reviews.Title: “modern , nice pool , bit out of town but easy reach”
Reviews.Author: PeterCUk
Reviews.Content: We booked this as the night before a cruise as it looked like it was near the port , in fact it is near a marina and quite a way from the port for cruise ships. hoowever it is on the green route tour bus from which you can see allof the city with a combined red blue and green ticket - 22 euros 1 day / 29 euros 2 days and well worth doing. Hotel very modern and high tech with coumputer controlled lights , temperature etc in your room , nice rooftop pool - not that big though nice breakfast , hot and cold buffet

Reviews.Title: “beutiful experience! would do it again!!”
Reviews.Author: zerofan
Reviews.Content: perfect hotel especially after we had to check out of one that had a four star rating and we coincidentally found Zero. it was really worlds apart and the staff and the environment the best ever!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable, tram and metro useful to get back into city”
Reviews.Author: JohnAU
Reviews.Content: Modern comfortable rooms with all the usual facilities. Free wifi was solid. Clean, quiet (despite the large block being built across the road) and spacious (Sea View Room). Nice spa on Floor -1 and modern terrace with a pool and loungers on Floor 17. Tram outside the door was very useful - taking 15 minutes to get you within walking distance of the Gothic centre, or down to the zoo or to the beach with it's many food places. If you want to get all the way into the centre the metro station was round the corner - this would get you everywhere. T-10 tickets were great value as you could mix metro and tram in one journey provided it was within an hour or so. There is very little in the immediate vicinity except the mall and the conference centre. Don't expect the "sea view" to be a romantic beach view - it's the sea the other side of the plaza in front of the conference centre. If I came to Barcelona again - now I know the layout better - I'd more likely try to find a similarly comfortable place closer to visitor attractions - but I would probably have to pay more and it might be more noisy. I'd recommend this with caveats regarding location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not much around”
Reviews.Author: scorp2413
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a spacious room. Most rooms in Europe are small but this has a lot of room to move. The staff went out of their way to help with whatever I needed. There is a mall next door and a conference center across the street. If you are looking to be in the middle off the tourist scene with resturants and such....this is not the place for you. The city tram is right outside the door and if you are good with public transportation this hotel would be great for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and a beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: ichirase
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and very comfortable, especially the beds. Unfortunately, It's nowhere near La Rambla but worth the metro/bus ride for the luxury.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute shocker”
Reviews.Author: Wazzy64
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the worst high end hotel I have ever stayed in. While the design is lovely, its an absolute triumph of form over substance. It took us 20 minutes to get into our room as the door lock didn't work, the water pressure is so bad filling a bath would take over an hour and the shower ran hot and cold. There is an "executive bar" on the roof but its rarely restocked (or cleaned) and the fridges dont work. So in the unlikely event they have been restocked, everything is warm. If you want a coffee or tea, you microwave the water. Really! Others in our party reported the lights turning themselves on at 4am and various other horrors. Service is unhelpful at best, surly at worst and the location is basically an industrial park miles away from anything other than the convention centre. Even if you were going to the convention centre, I would STRONGLY recommend staying in the old part of town and commuting. All up, totally appalling and outrageously bad value.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed service and not my style”
Reviews.Author: SnowjoHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for several nights at this hotel. The concierge Marta was excellent, very helpful in making reservations at some top places in the city. However when we checked in, our room was not the Jr Suite we had reserved but a standard room. It had an unpleasant smell coming from the bathroom. Housekeeping quickly rectified it, but by spraying air freshener all over the toilet seat. Toiletries were so-so - some shampoo, lotion and a little bar of soap - and there are no robes or slippers which would have been nice given the hardwood flooring. Shower head water pressure was a bit weak. The standard room size is just average and the layout is unusual with a built-in desk and cabinet in the middle of the room. This hotel is very contemporary, with modern indirect lighting and contactless keys. Two big pluses are the free WiFi and plentiful power plugs for charging phones, laptops, etc. Strangely, there is no driveway in front of the hotel for taxi drop-off so the cabs stop at the side of the road and you wheel your stuff in across the open area in front of the hotel. All in all, we appreciated the concierge here but the hardware and other service was not perfect. It is also away from the center of town so mainly for someone going to the convention centre or other business in the Forum area.

Reviews.Title: “Not directly in front of the sea, close to diagonal mar shopping center...”
Reviews.Author: vickymiracle
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not directly at the beach.. u have to cross the main street and walk a bit..and there is still construction on the beach side(actually every where..) we could enjoy the seaview from a distance of 500 meter.for us it was ok,in february swimming is not possible, but if u come to enjoy the sea or beach u can forget it because there is nothing..Metro station is close to the hotel, and it's easy to reach the city center. Also Diagonal shopping mall is very close.Our room was new,nice decorated and clean. There was also microwave oven,mini-bar,safe,LCD TV, wireless net connection in the room. Bathroom has a window whic is loking to the room but with a window blind. I don't know if there is a sea view room from 500 meter to the sea, our room was faced to a big contruction. The breakfast buffet was a bit dissapointing, but just if you consider that this is a 4 star hotel.. oh Staff !! most probably they prefer the hotel guests with a expensive reservation rates !...

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel witht the very best staff”
Reviews.Author: Rolex56
Reviews.Content: I use hotels a lot. Its rare to find one to excels beyond my expectations. This hotel did. I was with my wife and young children. Great location. My wife loved that we were very close to a big shopping mall. From the moment we arrived the staff went above and beyond what is expected of them. One gentleman (named Alexandro) on reception on the night we arrived was was so incredibly helpful that even my kids were impressed. All the staff we met during our stay were equally helpful. The room was excellent and the wi-fi was fast. I didn't have breakfast there as I considered 18 euro to be way to expensive for continental breakfast, But I would not hesitate in returning to this hotel or recommending it. The only thing I didnt like was that someone told me they allows pèts to stay. If true that would be such a shame as in my eyes any hotel that allows animals to stay in a room is substandard accommodation. If its not true this will be my hotel of choice in the Barcelona area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: irinuk_2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed in November 2009 at Diagonal Zero for 5 nights, for a conference. The hotel is situated in an area of Barcelona that is part residential, part business, so no tourist attractions around. That's not a problem as the subway station in only 5 minutes away and the area is pretty safe even at night. The room was large and clean, and so is the bathroom. I had a nice view of the sea and of the street. On the first night I had a problem: I couldn't find the switch for the hallway light, searching I found a touch-panel on a wall that controlled the room's lights, temperature and offered different info as well (problem solved). The wi-fi works excellent in the rooms and also in the lobby. Breakfast was good: hot and cold buffet in a large variety, excellent cakes. The staff was pretty OK, spoke good English. I also visited the pool on the last floor and outdoors, I think it's pretty spectacular in the summer when you can actually swim. The minus is the lack of places to eat in the area, there was a mall with the usual fast food chains and only 2 bars that served some food.

Reviews.Title: “Potentially nice hotel ruined by incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: Monday1000
Reviews.Content: This recently constructed hotel is light airy and comfortable. The modern room has touch screen controls for the airconditioning and an overengineered bathroom with designer plugs which take some time to work out. There is a lot of construction work going on in the area with some noise late at night, but this seemed to mostly be blocked out by the double glazing. However what should have been a pleasent stay was ruined by a series of errors by staff that transformed my visit into an unpleasant experience. 1) I ordered a salad and was served salt, with some salad on the side. 2) Learning from my this, for my next mea, I ordered a rump steak meal WITHOUT SALT, and the chips and vegetables came covered in salt. 3) For the next morning, I ordered a standard breakfast using room service and all that arrived was 1 small cup of coffee and 1 small glass of orange juice with no food. Apparently even though none of the contents of the standard breakfast apart from the choice of tea/coffee/juice have a tick box next to them (they have bullet points) you still have to tick them. 4) The night before checking out I requested a taxi for 4.30 am and a wake up call for 4.00 am. The staff booked the taxi for 4.00 am and the wake up call for 4.30 am. 5) After returning to the UK, I found that not all of the deposit that the hotel had taken on checking in had been returned to me. I was short by around $20, which the credit card company returned to me when I explained what the hotel had done. Finally to top it all off I received an e-mail from the hotel's "Revenue Manager", Alex Hereza, inviting me to review the hotel on Trip Advisor. Rather than leaving a bad review I wrote badk to Mr Hereza pointing out the problems I had experienced, but he never bothered to respond. So I've just put everything in my review here. So to sum up, this is potentially a very nice place to stay for business at a reasonable price, but just beware of the pitfalls involved in relying on the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Rastgoo
Reviews.Content: A fanatastic hotel with excellent ameneties and close to Metro station and Diagonal Mall. The staff are extremely helpful and kind. The breakfast usually is not included in the price of the room, but you can purchase the breakfast the night before at 25% discount from the receptionist. A very nice and fresh breakfast buffet awaits you in the morning with lots to choose from. If you are a fan of cereals, then the choices are limited to 3! some kids may be dissapointed. All attractions are reachable by Metro, or by Taxi. If you are a family of 4, the taxi cost is usually the same as taking the Metro. If taking a Metro, take a T10 (10 trips) which you can use for the family as well if you buy individual tickets it will be around 13.50 for 10 trips!

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, lovely room and great interior”
Reviews.Author: Cesoli
Reviews.Content: a bit way out if you are looking for a downtown barcelona hotel. but the hotel is nice and prices are good. lovely and helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, modern, clean and very helpful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: iportelli
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for a short weekend break and must admit that it exceeded my expectations. Altough a bit off center, very easy access to anywhere in the city through the Metro station located 2 mins away from the hotel. Very modern hotel with great in-room technology. Found the ice dispenser in each floor very handy and the breakfast was very good as well. To cap off a great experience in this hotel, the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Fabrizio who welcomed us with a big smile while checking in and went out of his way throughout the stay to help us plan where to visit and explain transport. Only positive things to say about this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and service”
Reviews.Author: EuropaNavigator
Reviews.Content: This is a well kept hotel and a reasonable value for the price. The standout is the very helpful staff who are the filling to this cake: They provided directions, maps, and phoned to enquire about tickets to a football match without being asked. You could not ask for better. It only goes to show that a businesses value lies in the quality of its people. And it was nice to get a room with a view of the Med. My only (minor) criticism is that the rooms need a bit more air to them. Since the windows do not open, there was a decided lack of fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business people”
Reviews.Author: baker_tony
Reviews.Content: Right across from international conference area. Large rooms Internet included The Spa area on floor "-1" is a MUST, perfect after a flight or day of work :-) Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and nice personnel”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneHH
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days here and we were very pleased with everything the hotel offered. An extra plus for the nice reception and understanding when our arrival was earlier than planned. Good and fresh breakfast. More international TV channels would have been nice. The hotel is a bit off central Barcelona but communications were good. It will probably be a nice area once the ongoing construction works are ready. We were, however not bothered by noise. Suzanne Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Nice and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: miljoona
Reviews.Content: We had left our kids to Finland and were looking for a short vacation just for the two of us. Diagonal Zero is located a bit off from the downtown noises, but that suited us very well. It had good connections through the Tram and Metro anyways. The rooms were big. We had the executive room at 14th floor with the sea view. There was another tall house being constructed just next to the hotel and that blocked part of the view, but it did not annoy us. The room price included free visits to the 15th floor lounge that had a very nice outdoor terrace. There were free drinks and some snacks (Spanish ham, cheeses, olives and alike). Newspapers were only in Spanish, but there were a couple of English magazines available. We visited the lounge several times during the visit and the food bowls were empty maybe half of the time. Also, the brochure said the lounge to be open till 22:00 every night, when it actually closed (service stopped) already at 20:30. Otherwise the lounge was a nice and - at this time of the year - almost always empty. The breakfast was good. Bread, cheeses, bacon, eggs, ham, salami, sausages, creps, pancakes, yoghurt, fresh watermelon and pineapple. A big variety of cakes and sweet rolls. My wife would have liked to have more fresh greens, but that was our only complain. The biggest negative surprise was that the 17th floor outside pool was closed (under maintenance) for the whole visit. There is a separate spa in the basement, but that goes with a separate cost. We did not go there this time but tested the nice gym on the last morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sandy251
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and friendly hotel. The staff are extremely helpful and go out of their way to be of service. I stayed there for a weekend with my partner who took part in the triathlon and it was only a 5 minute walk from the beach so was perfect for us. It is a lovely, clean hotel and the rooms are fairly large with hugh LCD tvs. Although we didn't spend much time in our room it was perfect for what we were looking for. I must also say that it had the most comfortable bed (apart from the one I have at home) that I have slept in when away as I find some beds extremely hard and uncomfortable. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, service & memories...”
Reviews.Author: chaoske
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night in this hotel, in the Jacuzzi suite... With the 15th lounge (amazing view, great music (!), and great private atmosphere), the swimming pool on the top floor,... It was all brand new, with the latest technologies available. The Jacuzzi suite is something you can only dream about... I emailed the staff on beforehand to work out something special to do with the room as we were on our honeymoon and they did so flawlessly. We'll definately come back! PS: only little minor where the construction works on 2 new hotels they're building in the neighborhood, but it's clear Diagonal hotel has little influence on these things :). To the staff: many thanks, you made our honeymoon even more complete! From the great big smile from the guy that parked our car to the people serving breakfast, it really includes everyone!

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sagit
Reviews.Content: it's a nice hotel generally.the breakfast buffet is very good with big variety.the stuff is friendly,and the rooms clean and nice.it's near metro(2 minutes on foot),and the tram line is outside the hotel.i would definitely give 5 for my rate to this hotel,but the only thing that i would like to mark is that something is missing...something that will make this hotel special for me
